intro: Grammitis palasaba, commonly known as the Palasaba fern, is a species of epiphytic fern native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. Its small, bright green leaves are covered in a dense layer of tiny, water-repellent scales. Grammitis palasaba plays a role in forest ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing microhabitats for various organisms.
